Class Schedule

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.user.schedule.Schedule

  • public class Schedule
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains information about the Schedule object
    Author:
    Samantha Ryan

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Schedule()
      Constructs a Schedule object with a default empty ArrayList and title "My Schedule"

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addCourseToSchedule(Course c)
      Adds a particular course to the schedule if there is no conflict and if it is not a duplicate course (duplicate meaning same course name, regardless of section
      boolean canAdd(Course c)
      Returns whether a particular course can be added to the schedule based on whether the course creates a conflict, is a duplicate, is null, or would cause the total credit hours to be greater than the maximum allowed
      int getScheduleCredits()
      Gets the number of credits that the student is currently enrolled in
      java.lang.String[][] getScheduledCourses()
      Returns a 2D String array representation of the courses in the schedule
      java.lang.String getTitle()
      Gets the title of the schedule
      boolean removeCourseFromSchedule(Course c)
      Removes a course from the schedule if it is in the schedule
      void resetSchedule()
      Resets the schedule to the default settings (removes all courses)
      void setTitle(java.lang.String t)
      Sets the title to a passed String

      • addCourseToSchedule

        public boolean addCourseToSchedule(Course c)
                            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Adds a particular course to the schedule if there is no conflict and if it is not a duplicate course (duplicate meaning same course name, regardless of section
        Parameters:
        c - course to be added to the schedule
        Returns:
        true if course is able to be added to schedule; false if otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there is a conflict in the scheduling

      • removeCourseFromSchedule

        Removes a course from the schedule if it is in the schedule
        Parameters:
        c - course to be removed from the schedule
        Returns:
        true if the course is able to be removed from the schedule; false otherwise

      • canAdd

        public boolean canAdd(Course c)
        Returns whether a particular course can be added to the schedule based on whether the course creates a conflict, is a duplicate, is null, or would cause the total credit hours to be greater than the maximum allowed
        Parameters:
        c - course to test
        Returns:
        true if the course can be added to this schedule; false if otherwise
